page.title: 21Basildon Town Centre 2011
page.content:
A lot has changed in Basildon Town Centre since the original Domesday article was written; many of the shops named have disappeared, either through closure or relocation. Dixons, Alders, C&A, Army & Navy all closed down; Sainsbury's relocated to an out-of-town store and, in it's place came Asda. Back when the original article was written, there were high hopes for a roof for the Town Centre - this didn't happen, and instead there have been a number of new retail blocks added on the edges of the Town Square, including the Westgate.

As in many other shopping centres and high streets, where once there were branches of Woolworths, Co-Op and C&A, there are now branches of Poundland, 99p or Less and Primark.

The town centre's cinema closed down, and has not been replaced. The market is still going, though some of the original stalls have been replaced with timber cabins.

The shopping area still seems busy, though it has been hit in recent years by such Out-of-town developments as Pipps Hill, Lakeside, and Bluewater.
Contribution by: Paul Bines
